# Initial information

The original raw dataset contained `r n_obs_survey_raw` respondents, of which we were able to geocode `r n_obs_survey_geocoded` observations.
`r n_obs_survey_geocoded - nrow(survey_filter_cd)` of them declared their residential location outside a 250 meter buffer around the island of Montreal (`CD == 2466`), leaving us with `r nrow(survey_filter_cd)` observations in the final dataset.

# Spatial distribution {#sec-spatial}

```{r}
#| include: false
fsa <- montreal_fsa %>% 
  select(geouid) %>% 
  rename("fsa_geouid" = "geouid")
ct <- montreal_cd_ct %>% 
  select(geo_uid, count_lim_tot_parent, count_lim_tot_in_lim) %>% 
  rename("ct_geo_uid" = "geo_uid")

fsa_ct_join <- sf::st_join(fsa, ct)

total_lim_sum <- sum(montreal_cd_ct$count_lim_tot_parent)

fsa_ct_grouped <- fsa_ct_join %>% 
  group_by(fsa_geouid) %>% 
  summarise(
    sum_lim_tot_parent = sum(count_lim_tot_parent, na.rm = T)
    , sum_lim_tot_in_lim = sum(count_lim_tot_in_lim, na.rm = T)
    , prop_tot_pop = sum_lim_tot_parent / total_lim_sum
    , prop_tot_in_lim = sum_lim_tot_in_lim / total_lim_sum
  )
```


## Over 50 years 
Below, we plot the spatial distribution of the sample against the spatial distribution of the population over 50 years old, according to the 2021 Census.
We see that the survey over represents on the eastern part of the island, and somewhat in its center. 
The CTs that are under represented are located in the western part.

